resources.name: BaaS | Caradhras
resources.description:
# Welcome to Caradhras

This repository is an API documentation to the Banking as a Service ("BaaS") platform, powered by **DOCK**. The BaaS is a business unit that provides a variety of banking services in a B2B business model, enabling partners (or sub-issuers) to deliver a banking experience to its customers with no need of having a bank license attached, free of bureaucracy. As we usually say: ready to go.

The API Platform is called **Caradhras**, in honor of our "cultural stack". Click [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caradhras) to find out more information. Caradhras will allow you to access data and different resources through a set of APIs, providing an easy way to manage financial resources from your customers (or account holders).

The step-by-step should be to proceed with the download of this API Collection to your [Postman](http://www.getpostman.com), by clicking on the `Run in Postman` button on the top right of this page.


---

# Architecture

If you are familiar to RESTful orchestrators, Caradhras could be named as a powerful one. It gives access to partners to manage its entire database and be able to manage a wide variety of financial transactions, through a set of REST APIs.

Everything starts with a Payment Account. The Payment Account has different alternatives to Cash-in and some others to Cash-Out.

Accessing Caradhras, your team will be able to:

 - Create Individuals in the platform, fully screened by KYC standards
 - Create Payment Accounts for these Individuals, giving them the ability to manage its holdings
 - Create transactions that goes from i) swipe card transactions, ii) payment of bills, iii) pre-paid phone recharge, iv) bank transfers

```
7 - Liquida√ß√£o Boleto
```

*`bonus` is the amount of rate waive that the carrier will have
*`leftOver` counter that shows the amount of rate waive remaining
*`person` person's id that will receive the gratuity

resources.name: /tolls/recharges
resources.description:
This API generates a cryptogram based on the data received in the request. After that, it debits the account 09 (final account) and credits the account informed in the request.


| FIELD NAME | FIELD TYPE | DESCRIPTION | REQUIRED |
|     :-----------------------------:     |--------------------------|-----------|------------------|
| accountNumber | Number | Account number to be debited | Y |
| hexCardNumber | Alpha | This is the card number masked. The mask is BIN + FF + Rest of card number + FF For example, for the card 12345678912345678 the mask should be: 123456FF78912345678FF | Y | 
| internalCounterHex | Number | Amount of transactions with the card in hexadecimal format. This field will be incremented with 1, before cryptogram be generated | Y |
| transactionPartnerNumber | Number | This field is the id of the transaction. It will be used in all future requests | Y |
| debitValue | Decimal | The value to be debited from the account and which the cryptogram is based on. This field must be sent as string, for example, ‚Äú1.00‚Äù, because we discard the decimal separator and assume two decimal digits | Y |
| transactionCounter | Number | Card's transaction counter | Y |
| cardBalance | Number | Card's balance. This field must be sent as string, for example, ‚Äú1.00‚Äù, because we discard the decimal separator and assume two decimal digits | Y |
| requestDate | Date | Request date to be saved into crytogram. Format: yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss | Y |

resources.name: /tolls/recharges
resources.description:
1) In case of `cancel the transaction`, the balance (credit + fee) will be sent back to the original account.

2) In case of `confirm the transaction`, the credit value will be sent to the final account (09), internally called lock funds, because the partner is not supposed to have access to this amount. It‚Äôs only for conference. The fee amount will be sent to the partner account (06).

| FIELD NAME | FIELD TYPE | DESCRIPTION | REQUIRED |
|     :-----------------------------:     |--------------------------|-----------|------------------|
| ChargeIsConfirmed | Boolean | True to confirm a recharge. False to cancel a recharge | Y |
| transactionCertificate | Alpha | Transaction certificate, generated by the partner | Y |
| transactionPartnerNumber | Number | Transaction‚Äôs id | Y |

resources.name: /tolls/recharges
resources.description:
The API works in two step process. First, it requests a recharge cryptogram, this will be saved into the card. At this moment the recharge amount and fee amount is taken from the original account (informed in the request) and transferred to a transitory account.
After that, the it must call a second endpoint to confirm or cancel the recharge.



| FIELD NAME | FIELD TYPE | DESCRIPTION | REQUIRED |
|     :-----------------------------:     |--------------------------|-----------|------------------|
| accountNumber | Number | Account number to be debited | Y |
| hexCardNumber | Alpha | This is the card number masked. The mask is BIN + FF + Rest of card number + FF For example, for the card 12345678912345678 the mask should be: 123456FF78912345678FF | Y | 
| internalCounterHex | Number | Amount of transactions with the card in hexadecimal format. This field will be incremented with 1, before cryptogram be generated | Y |
| transactionPartnerNumber | Number | This field is the id of the transaction. It will be used in all future requests. The maximum character allowed is 15 | Y |
| feeTollValue | Decimal | The fee to be credited into the partner account. This field must be sent as string, for example, ‚Äú1.00‚Äù, because we discard the decimal separator and assume two decimal digits | Y |
| creditTollValue | Decimal | The value to be credited into the card and wihch the cryptogram is based on. This field must be sent as string, for example, ‚Äú1.00‚Äù, because we discard the decimal separator and assume two decimal digits | Y |
| transactionCounter | Number | Card's transaction counter | Y |
| cardBalance | Number | Card's balance. This field must be sent as string, for example, ‚Äú1.00‚Äù, because we discard the decimal separator and assume two decimal digits | Y |
| requestDate | Date | Request date to be saved into crytogram. Format: yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss | Y |

resources.name: /cartoes/lotes-cartoes-pre-pagos
resources.description:
This endpoint only applies for no-name cards Business Model.

This operation has the purpose of allowing Issuers to manage a certain amount of Prepaid Cards, in a non-nominal manner, which may be marketed and subsequently linked to a customer that purchases it. To do this, in addition to defining how many cards should be generated, it will be possible to define the Business Source, Product, Card Type, Image and Address for delivery of the Cards present in the generated batch. By default, all cards will be associated with a fictitious idPessoa and will receive a unique idConta for each of them. Once this is done, the Cards generated by this operation will follow the same graphic printing processes previously defined between the Issuer and the Driver

> Check the documentation [here](https://s3-sa-east-1.amazonaws.com/baas-docs.caradhras.io/Fields_Card.pdf) for addicional information about identification fields.


> Check the FAQs below:
> 
> - [How to request - NoName Card](https://baas-cdt.zendesk.com/hc/pt-br/articles/360020758991)

resources.description: This resource allows to be created a virtual card for a determined cardholder which one it is linked to an account. For this, it will be necessary to inform the identification code of the account (id). This functionability can be used to creat virtual cards through an App. First of all, it will be necessary to align with the project leader about the use of this endpoint

resources.name: /contas/{idAccount}/gerar-cartao-grafica
resources.description:
This resource allows to be generate a new Card for a determined cardholder that it is linked to the account. For this, it‚Äôll be necessary to inform the id account , the `idPessoa` of the cardholder and the `idTipoPlastico`of the card that will be printed, defined on the setup process. This functionality will be used for the card printing in graphic.

- This API enables the creation of a physical card. Right after this, it is mandatory to call the `POST /cartoes/{idcard}/cadastrar-senha` to define the card password . Succefully done this process, the embosser will automatically receive the card printing order to emboss and deliver.
- To unlock a physical card, the embossing phase needs to be completly done, then you must call the method `POST /cartoes/{idCard}/desbloquear`
- When using this endpoint, the cardholder will receive no charge of fee (either first issue or reissue)

> Check the documentation [here](https://s3-sa-east-1.amazonaws.com/baas-docs.caradhras.io/Fields_Card.pdf) for addicional information about identification fields.

resources.name: /cartoes/{idCard}/gerar-nova-via
resources.description:
This operation allows the issuers or their customers to request a new VIA from the card that will be forwarded for printing and posting according to the standard demand already defined by the issuer. For this, it is necessary that the client already has a card and inform its id code so that the client can use this operation. Therefore, this functionality applies only to physical generation cards.

- The new card will be created with the same password from the previous card.
- When using this endpoint, the cardholder will be charged according to the fee defined in the setup (regardless of the cancellation reason)
- This endpoint __must only__ be used with a physical card, otherwise it will generate a physical card from a virtual card.

resources.name: Register Clients
resources.description:
There are two ways to create an account:

1) Using the endpoint **POST** `/individuals/accounts` it is possible to create an individual and an account at the same time.

2) The other way depends on whether the person already exists or not. If the person has not been registered, it can be created from the endpoint **POST** `/individuals` or **POST** `/clientes/pj`. This endpoint returns a person ID along with the other person's information. From this ID it is possible to create an account through the endpoint **POST** `/contas`.


- To list all physical persons created, use the endpoint **GET** `/individuals`.
- To consult information about the physical person created, use the endpoints **GET** `/individuals/{id}`
- To list all accounts created, use the endpoint **GET** `/contas`
- To consult information about the account created, use the endpoints **GET** `/contas/{idAccount}`

resources.name: /oauth2/token
resources.description:
OAuth 2.0 is the industry-standard protocol for authorization. OAuth 2.0 focuses on client developer simplicity while providing specific authorization flows for web applications, desktop applications, mobile phones, and living room devices.



For the consumption of our API's, we chose the `client_credentials` stream. We will provide the credentials in the form `client_id`, `client_secret`.

At the first call of our API's, your application must authenticate with our credentials provider through a POST request at url `https://auth.hml.caradhras.io/oauth2/token?grant_type=client_credentials` using the form of authentication Basic Auth with the credentials we provided in the previous step, including the `Content-Type` header with the `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` value. Content will be returned as follows:



```
{
    "access_token": "eyJraWQiOiXXXXXXXXXXXXXX.eyJziI2cXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXQ.PSvxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxM23GPFNuA",
    "expires_in": 3600,
    "token_type": "Bearer"
}
```

- The `expires_in` field determines the validity time of the token in seconds. When it is close to expiration, a new call must be made to obtain a new token.

- Once this is done, simply call the desired resource by passing the contents of the access_token to a Header of the request named Authorization in the following:

```
{
    "Authorization": "Bearer eyJraWQiOiXXXXXXXXXXXXXX.eyJziI2cXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXQ.PSvxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxM23GPFNuA"
}
```

#### Safety Recommendations

Here are some recommendations for use:

* Do not store the client_id and client_secret in the same application database that will consume resources.
* Do not in any way leave the credentials available to people / systems that should not have access to them.
* Do not version the credentials along with the application source code.
* In case of compromise of the credentials, you must immediately let our team know to revoke them.
* The custody of the credentials is the responsibility of the client.
*

Allow to create the register of a Physical Person, receiving in this operation all the register dates which are necessary for this. Once created, it will allow the method Card Creation for the client and their additionals.


> Check the documentation [here](https://s3-sa-east-1.amazonaws.com/baas-docs.caradhras.io/Fields_Register_Client.pdf) for additional information about `identification fields`.
>
> Check the documentation [here](https://s3-sa-east-1.amazonaws.com/baas-docs.caradhras.io/StatusCode_individual_account.pdf) for additional information about `Know Your Client errors` and `errors status code`.


> Check the FAQs below:
>
> - [Why all accounts should have card associated?](https://baas-cdt.zendesk.com/hc/pt-br/articles/360027496192)



In some cases, the CPF does not exist in the database, then it is not possible to validate any cadastral information. In order not to impact the user, the registration is accepted even without automatic validation, but is sent for analysis that requires a manual checks and take some action if necessary. In this case, the Partner is always advised.

resources.name: /registrations
resources.description:
This method submits a company to registration.

 

PARAMETERS

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

company

Company details.

Array

    

nationalRegistration

Company national registration (CNPJ).

String

Yes

size = 14.

legalName

Company legal name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

legalNature

Company legal nature.

String

No

size = 4. Must be a valid legal nature code

legalStatus

Company legal status.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

tradeName

Company trade name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

dateEstablishment

Company foundation date.

Date

Yes

Date in the past; ISO 8601 format.

establishmentFormat

Company establishment format.

String

Yes

[EI, MEI, EIRELI, LTDA, SS, SA, ME, EPP, EMGP].

stateRegistration

Company state registration.

Integer

No

max size = 16.

email

Company mail address.

String

Yes

  email format

revenue

Company annual revenue.

Double 

Yes

default: 0.0.

partnerChanged

Flag to identify a recently change in business partnership

Boolean

Yes

  

mainCnae

Main cnae.

Number

Yes

size =  6 or 7.

cnaes

Other cnaes.

Number

No

size =  6 or 7.

mainPhone

Main phone details.

Object

Yes

  

phones

Additional phones details.

Object

No

  

mainAddress

Main address details.

Object

Yes

  

adresses

Additional addresses details.

Object

No

  

partners

Partners details.

Object

Yes

  

productSettings

Product settings details.

Object

Yes

  

 

OBJECT: mainPhone

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

countryCode

Country code number.

Number

Yes

value = 55.

area

Area code number.

Number

Yes

size = 2.

number

Phone number.

Number

Yes

Numeric. Size = 8 or 9 (only if the first number is 9)

type

Phone type.

String

Yes

MOBILE or LANDLINE.

 

OBJECT: phones

Same parameters as object mainPhone.

 

OBJECT: mainAddress

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

street

Street name.

String

Yes

max size = 235.

number

Address number.

Number

Yes

value > 0.

complement

Address complement.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

zip

Zip-code.

String

Yes

size = 8.

neighborhood

Neighborhood name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

city

City name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

state

State name.

String

Yes

size = 2.

country

Country name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

 

OBJECT: addresses

Same parameters as object mainAddress.

 

OBJECT: partners

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

individuals

Partner details (natural people).

Object

Yes

  

companies

Partner details (legal perople).

Object

No

  

 

OBJECT: individuals

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

profile

Hierarchical level.

String

Yes

[OWNER, ATTORNEY]

type

Profile type.

Array

Yes

[MASTER]

name

Partner name.

String

Yes

alphabetical; max size = 255.

dateBirth

Partner birth date.

Date

Yes*

Date in the past; ISO 8601 format.

motherName

Partner mother’s name.

String

Yes*

alphabetical; max size = 255.

gender

Partner gender.

String

No

[MALE, FEMALE, OTHER, NOT SPECIFIED].

maritalStatus

Partner marital status.

String

No

[SINGLE, MARRIED, DIVORCED, WIDOWER]

email

Partner mail address.

String

Yes*

  

occupation

Partner occupation.

String

No

max size = 255.

isPep

Politically exposed person.

Boolean

Yes

  

revenue

Partner annual revenue.

Number

No

  

nationalRegistration

Partner national registration ID.

Number

Yes

size = 11.

identityCard

State registration details.

Object

No

  

mainPhone

Partner main phone number.

Object

Yes*

  

phones

Partner additional phone numbers.

Object

No

  

mainAddress

Partner main address.

Object

Yes*

  

addresses

Partner additional addresses.

Object

No

  

 *only if type is "MASTER". Partners not defined as "MASTER" should not be able to do financial transactions.

OBJECT: identityCard

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

number

  State registration number (RG)

String

Yes

  

dispatcher

  Public agency that issued the identity.

String

No

max size = 255.

federativeUnit

  Abbreviation of the state that issued the identity.

String

No

size = 2.

dateIssuance

  Date when identity was issued.

Date

No

Date in the past; ISO 8601 format.

 

OBJECT: companies

Parameter

Description

Value

Required

Restrictions

company

Company details.

Array

    

nationalRegistration

Company national registration (CNPJ).

String

Yes

size = 14.

legalName

Company legal name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

legalNature

Company legal nature.

String

No

size = 4.

legalStatus

Company legal status.

String

No

max size = 255.

tradeName

Company trade name.

String

Yes

max size = 255.

dateEstablishment

Company foundation date.

Date

No

Date in the past; ISO 8601 format.

establishmentFormat

Company establishment format.

String

No

[EI, MEI, EIRELI, LTDA, SS, SA, ME, EPP, EMGP].

stateRegistration

Company state registration.

Integer

No

max size = 16.

email

Company mail address.

String

No

  

revenue

Company annual revenue.

Double 

No

default: 0.0.

mainCnae

Main cnae.

Number

No

size =  6 or 7.

cnaes

other cnaes

Array

No

size =  6 or 7.

mainPhone

 Partner main phone number. Object No  

phones

 Partner additional phone numbers. Array No  

mainAddress

 Partner main address. Object No  

addresses

 Partner additional addresses. Array No  

 

OBJECT: productSettings

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

idProduct

Company product ID.

Number

Yes

  

idBusinessSource

Business source ID

Integer

Yes

 

printedCardName

Name printed on the card.

String

Yes

max size=21

externalAccountNumber

External authorization.

String

No

max size = 16.

termsAndConditionsTokens

Terms and conditions tokens details.

Object

Yes

  

deviceIdentification

Device identification details.

Object

Yes

  

 

OBJECT: deviceIdentification

PARAMETER

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

REQUIRED

RESTRICTIONS

fingerprint

device identification. User Agent or Serial number, plus ipv4 or ipv6, separated by a #

Number

Yes

  

 

Response Fields

Field

DESCRIPTION

VALUE

idRegistration

id that identifies an attempt to register a company while it's is not successfuly registered

string (uuid v4)
